parameters.description: The token for API access, using to identify your permission to the api. Valid for multiple use and expires in 4 hours.

parameters.name: shop_id
parameters.description: Shopee's unique identifier for a shop. Required param for most APIs.

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: Specifies the starting entry of data to return in the current call. Default is 0. if data is more than one page, the offset can be some entry to start next call.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: if many items are available to retrieve, you may need to call GetReturnList multiple times to retrieve all the data. Each result set is returned as a page of entries. Default is 40. Use the Pagination filters to control the maximum number of entries (<= 100) to retrieve per page (i.e., per call), the offset number to start next call. This integer value is usUed to specify the maximum number of entries to return in a single ""page"" of data.

parameters.name: create_time_from
parameters.description: The create_time_from and create_time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the order create time). The create_time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the create_time_from and create_time_to fields is 15 days.

parameters.name: create_time_to
parameters.description: The create_time_from and create_time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the order create time). The create_time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the create_time_from and create_time_to fields is 15 days.

parameters.name: update_time_from
parameters.description: The update_time_from and update_time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the last return updated time). The update_time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the update_time_from and update_time_to fields is 15 days. update_time_from should be >= create_time_from

parameters.name: update_time_to
parameters.description: The update_time_from and update_time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the last return updated time). The update_time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the update_time_from and update_time_to fields is 15 days. update_time_from should be >= create_time_from

request_id.description: The identifier for an API request for error tracking

error.description: error code

message.description: error description

more.description: Whether has next page

reason.description: Reason for return product. Applicable values: See Data Definition- ReturnReason.

update_time.description: The time of modify return.

status.description: Enumerated type that defines the current status of the return. Applicable values: See Data Definition- ReturnStatus.

due_date.description: The last time seller deal with this return.

tracking_number.description: The tracking number assigned by the shipping carrier for item shipment.

dispute_reason.description: The reason of seller dispute return. While the return has been disputed, this field is useful. Applicable values: See Data Definition- ReturnDisputeReason.

dispute_text_reason.description: The reason that seller provide. While the return has been disputed, this field is useful.

needs_logistics.description: Items to be sent back to seller. Can be either integrated/non-integrated.

username.description: Buyer's nickname, will be masked as "****" if it is a non-integrated return in TW region.

email.description: Buyer's email, will be empty if it is a non-integrated return in TW region.

portrait.description: Buyer's portrait, will be empty if it is a non-integrated return in TW region.

model_id.description: Shopee's unique identifier for a variation of an item.

name.description: Name of item in local language.

is_add_on_deal.description: To indicate if this item belongs to an addon deal.

is_main_item.description: To indicate if this item is main item or sub item. True means main item, false means sub item.

add_on_deal_id.description: The unique identity of an addon deal.

order_sn.description: Shopee's unique identifier for an order.

return_ship_due_date.description: The due date for buyer to ship order.

return_seller_due_date.description: The due date for seller to deal with this return when buyer have shipped order.

return_refund_type.description: To indicate whether the return is RRBOC (Return/Refund request raised before Order Complete) or RRAOC (Return/Refund request raised after Order Complete).

return_solution.description:
To indicate the most updated solution of the Return/Refund request (NOTE: this is not the solution during negotiation). Applicable value: 

- 0: Return and Refund

- 1: Refund Only

is_seller_arrange.description: To indicate whether the return_sn is using the “Seller Arrange” return method. This would only be True for TW and BR.

is_shipping_proof_mandatory.description: To indicate whether uploading shipping proof is mandatory for seller to confirm "Arrange Pickup" when is_seller_arrange = true.

return_refund_request_type.description:
To indicate the type of return refund request, whether it is a Normal RR request, an In-transit RR request, and a Return on the Spot: 

0: Normal RR (RR is raised by the buyer after delivery done / estimated delivery date)

1: In-transit RR (RR is raised by the buyer while item is still in-transit to buyer)

2: Return-on-the-Spot (RR is raised by the driver after buyer rejected parcel at delivery)


For more details, see Data Definition- Return Refund Request Type.

validation_type.description:
To indicate whether seller or warehouse will expect to receive the return parcel from buyer and validate the condition of the parcel: 

- seller_validation 

- warehouse_validation


For more details, see Data Definition- ValidationType.

is_arrived_at_warehouse.description:
[Only for validation_type = warehouse_validation] Indicates the parcel’s check-in status at the warehouse. This field helps sellers quickly determine whether the parcel has arrived at the warehouse or has been rejected. 


Applicable values:

1: Pending Inbound

2: Rejected

3: Inbound

4: Cancelled

model_id.description: Unique identifier of the model under the item.

qty.description: Quantity of items or models under the same current status.

current_status.description:
Current status for the item/model within the warehouse.


Applicable values:

1：Dispose

2：Return to Seller

7：Received and Putaway

8：Return to Buyer

9：Shortage


Note: Since Resell is currently applicable only to Failed Delivery parcels, the following values will not be returned for now, and will be returned once Resell becomes applicable to Return Refund parcels in the future:

3：Putaway for Resell

4：Resell Outbound

5：Resell Failed

6：Resell Exit

related_order_sn_list.description:
List of order_sn generated from the Resell process. Returned only when current_status = 4 (Resell Outbound).


Note: Since Resell is currently applicable only to Failed Delivery parcels, this field will remain empty for now, and valid values will be returned once Resell becomes applicable to Return Refund parcels in the future.

resell_failed_next_step.description:
Next step after a Resell failure. Returned only when current_status = 5 (Resell Failed).


Note: Since Resell is currently applicable only to Failed Delivery parcels, this field will remain empty for now, and valid values will be returned once Resell becomes applicable to Return Refund parcels in the future.

follow_up_action_list.description: [Only for validation_type = warehouse_validation] Warehouse handling actions for each item in the parcel.

get.description:
Get reverse and post-return logistics information of return request. For Normal RR, return complete reverse logistics information, for In-transit RR and Return-on-the-Spot, only return latest reverse logistics status, without providing complete reverse logistics information. For seller_validation, only one segment of reverse (buyer to seller), use tracking_info, for warehouse_validation, two segment of reverse (buyer to warehouse and warehouse to seller), use post_return_logistics_tracking_info.

### Potential Errors
| Error Code | Description |
|---|---|
| returns.error_reverse_logistics_tracking_info | Failed to get reverse logistics tracking info |
| returns.error_order_fulfilment_group | Failed to get order fulfilment group |
| returns.error_post_return_logistics_data | Failed to get post return logistics data |
| returns.error_logistics_status_audit | Failed to get return logistics status audit |
| returns.error_reverse_logistics | The Return SN does not have reverse logistics status |
| returns.return_not_found | Return not found |
| returns.missing_return_sn | Return SN is a required parameter |

parameters.name: return_sn
parameters.description: Shopee's unique identifier for a return/refund request (serial number of return).

error.description: Indicate error type if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

message.description: Indicate error details if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

request_id.description: The identifier for an API request for error tracking.

return_sn.description: Shopee's unique identifier for a return/refund request (serial number of return).

return_refund_request_type.description:
To indicate the type of return refund request, whether it is a Normal RR request, an In-transit RR request, and a Return on the Spot: 

0: Normal RR (RR is raised by the buyer after delivery done / estimated delivery date)

1: In-transit RR (RR is raised by the buyer while item is still in-transit to buyer)

2: Return-on-the-Spot (RR is raised by the driver after buyer rejected parcel at delivery)


For more details, see Data Definition- Return Refund Request Type.

validation_type.description:
To indicate whether seller or warehouse will expect to receive the return parcel from buyer and validate the condition of the parcel: 

- seller_validation 

- warehouse_validation


For more details, see Data Definition- ValidationType.

reverse_logistics_status.description:
To indicate the latest reverse logistic status of a return, referring to the current status of the buyer shipping the return parcel back to the validation point (seller or warehouse), including Normal RR, In-transit RR, and Return-on-the-Spot.


See "Data Definition - ReverseLogisticsStatus" as status displayed for Normal RR and In-transit RR or Return-on-the-Spot are different.


Note: If validation_type = seller_validation, there is only one segment of reverse logistics (The buyer ships the return parcel directly back to the seller). Please use the fields reverse_logistics_status, reverse_logistics_update_time, tracking_number, and tracking_info to obtain the reverse logistics tracking information.

reverse_logistics_update_time.description:
The last update time of the reverse logistics status including Normal RR, In-transit RR, and Return-on-the-Spot.


Note: If validation_type = seller_validation, there is only one segment of reverse logistics (The buyer ships the return parcel directly back to the seller). Please use the fields reverse_logistics_status, reverse_logistics_update_time, tracking_number, and tracking_info to obtain the reverse logistics tracking information.

estimated_delivery_date_max.description:
The maximum estimated delivery date for the reverse logistics. This is calculated by Shopee Logistics Services once buyer ships out if there is historical tracking data available from third party logistics provider. 


Note: Only available for Normal RR with integrated reverse logistics.

estimated_delivery_date_min.description:
The minimum estimated delivery date for the reverse logistics. This is calculated by Shopee Logistics Services once buyer ships out if there is historical tracking data available from third party logistics provider.


Note: Only available for Normal RR with integrated reverse logistics.

tracking_number.description:
The tracking number for the reverse logistics (the logistics tracking number provided when the buyer ships the item back).


Note: 

- Only available for Normal RR with integrated reverse logistics.

- If validation_type = seller_validation, there is only one segment of reverse logistics (The buyer ships the return parcel directly back to the seller). Please use the fields reverse_logistics_status, reverse_logistics_update_time, tracking_number, and tracking_info to obtain the reverse logistics tracking information.

update_time.description: The timestamps when reverse logistics info has been updated for Normal RR, pushed from third party logistics provider to Shopee.

tracking_description.description: The description of reverse logistics tracking info for Normal RR, pushed by third party logistics provider to Shopee.

epop_image_list.description: Image URLs of electronic proof of pickup (ePOP) after return parcel has been picked up from the buyer for Normal RR.

epod_image_list.description: Image URLs of electronic proof of delivery (ePOD) after return parcel has been delivered to the seller for Normal RR.

tracking_info.description:
The detailed tracking information list for the reverse logistics.


Note: 

- Only available for Normal RR with integrated reverse logistics, with the tracking information pushed by third party logistics provider to Shopee.

- If validation_type = seller_validation, there is only one segment of reverse logistics (The buyer ships the return parcel directly back to the seller). Please use the fields reverse_logistics_status, reverse_logistics_update_time, tracking_number, and tracking_info to obtain the reverse logistics tracking information.

post_return_logistics_status.description:
Post-return logistics status, referring to the current status of the warehouse shipping the return parcel back to the seller in warehouse validation mode. See "Data Definition - Post Return Logistics Status".


Note: 

- Only available for Normal RR with return_solution = 0 (Return and Refund) and validation_type = warehouse_validation, and the warehouse ships the return parcel back to seller using integrated reverse logistics.

- If validation_type = warehouse_validation AND the warehouse uses an integrated logistics channel to ship the return parcel back to the seller, there are two segments of reverse logistics: 

- The buyer first ships the return parcel back to the warehouse. Use the fields reverse_logistics_status, reverse_logistics_update_time, tracking_number, and tracking_info to obtain tracking information for this first segment.

- The warehouse then ships the return parcel back to the seller. Use the fields post_return_logistics_status, post_return_logistics_update_time, rts_tracking_number, and post_return_logistics_tracking_info to obtain tracking information for this second segment (post-return logistics).

- For Cross-Border Returns, if the second segment exists, the API returns information for both the first and second segments. For Local Returns, if the second segment exists, the API prioritizes and returns only the second segment information.

post_return_logistics_update_time.description:
The last update time of the post-return logistics status where warehouse sends return parcel from warehouse to seller.


Note: 

- Only available for Normal RR with return_solution = 0 (Return and Refund) and validation_type = warehouse_validation, and the warehouse ships the return parcel back to seller using integrated reverse logistics.

- If validation_type = warehouse_validation AND the warehouse uses an integrated logistics channel to ship the return parcel back to the seller, there are two segments of reverse logistics: 

- The buyer first ships the return parcel back to the warehouse. Use the fields reverse_logistics_status, reverse_logistics_update_time, tracking_number, and tracking_info to obtain tracking information for this first segment.

- The warehouse then ships the return parcel back to the seller. Use the fields post_return_logistics_status, post_return_logistics_update_time, rts_tracking_number, and post_return_logistics_tracking_info to obtain tracking information for this second segment (post-return logistics).

- For Cross-Border Returns, if the second segment exists, the API returns information for both the first and second segments. For Local Returns, if the second segment exists, the API prioritizes and returns only the second segment information.

rts_tracking_number.description:
The tracking number for the post-return logistics (the logistics tracking number used when the warehouse ships the parcel back to the seller). RTS stands for "Return to Seller".


Note: 

- Only available for Normal RR with return_solution = 0 (Return and Refund) and validation_type = warehouse_validation, and the warehouse ships the return parcel back to seller using integrated reverse logistics.

- If validation_type = warehouse_validation AND the warehouse uses an integrated logistics channel to ship the return parcel back to the seller, there are two segments of reverse logistics: 

- The buyer first ships the return parcel back to the warehouse. Use the fields reverse_logistics_status, reverse_logistics_update_time, tracking_number, and tracking_info to obtain tracking information for this first segment.

- The warehouse then ships the return parcel back to the seller. Use the fields post_return_logistics_status, post_return_logistics_update_time, rts_tracking_number, and post_return_logistics_tracking_info to obtain tracking information for this second segment (post-return logistics).

- For Cross-Border Returns, if the second segment exists, the API returns information for both the first and second segments. For Local Returns, if the second segment exists, the API prioritizes and returns only the second segment information.

update_time.description: The timestamps when reverse logistics info has been updated for Normal RR from warehouse to seller, pushed from third party logistics provider to Shopee.

tracking_description.description:
The description of reverse logistics tracking info for Normal RR from warehouse to seller, pushed by third party logistics provider to Shopee.


These would match the tracking description displayed to sellers on Seller Center return/refund detail page.

epop_image_list.description: Image URLs of electronic proof of pickup (ePOP) after return parcel has been picked up from the warehouse for Normal RR with warehouse validation.

epod_image_list.description: Image URLs of electronic proof of delivery (ePOD) after return parcel has been delivered to the seller for Normal RR with warehouse validation.

post_return_logistics_tracking_info.description:
Only available for Normal RR with return_solution = 0 (Return and Refund) and validation_type = warehouse_validation, and the warehouse ships the return parcel back to seller using integrated reverse logistics.


In this scenario, the tracking logistics from warehouse to seller is called "post-return logistics", with the tracking information pushed by third party logistics provider to Shopee.


Note: 

- If validation_type = warehouse_validation AND the warehouse uses an integrated logistics channel to ship the return parcel back to the seller, there are two segments of reverse logistics: 

- The buyer first ships the return parcel back to the warehouse. Use the fields reverse_logistics_status, reverse_logistics_update_time, tracking_number, and tracking_info to obtain tracking information for this first segment.

- The warehouse then ships the return parcel back to the seller. Use the fields post_return_logistics_status, post_return_logistics_update_time, rts_tracking_number, and post_return_logistics_tracking_info to obtain tracking information for this second segment (post-return logistics).

- For Cross-Border Returns, if the second segment exists, the API returns information for both the first and second segments. For Local Returns, if the second segment exists, the API prioritizes and returns only the second segment information.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve the current status and result of a video upload task. You can also use video_upload_result_push to get notified immediately when a video upload reaches a final status (SUCCEEDED, FAILED, or CANCELLED).

parameters.name: partner_id
parameters.description: Partner ID is assigned upon registration is successful. Required for all requests.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: This is to indicate the timestamp of the request. Required for all requests. Expires in 5 minutes.

parameters.name: video_upload_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the upload task, returned by v2.media.init_video_upload.

error.description: Indicate error type if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

message.description: Indicate error details if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

warning.description: Indicate warning message you should take care.

request_id.description: The identifier for an API request for error tracking.

status.description:
Current status of the upload task. Possible values:

- INITIATED: Upload task has been created (via init_video_upload) but no parts have been uploaded yet.

- UPLOADING: Video file parts are being uploaded. The upload has started but is not yet completed.

- UPLOADED: All video parts have been uploaded successfully, waiting for complete_video_upload to trigger processing.

- PROCESSING: Video is being transcoded/validated by the system (duration, format, resolution checks).

- SUCCEEDED: Video upload and transcoding completed successfully. Video URL and cover URL are available for use.

- FAILED: Upload or processing failed (e.g., invalid format, duration not within allowed range, transcoding error).

- CANCELLED: Upload task was explicitly canceled by the client (cancel_video_upload), and the video is discarded.

reason.description: Detailed fail or cancel reason, will be returned if status is FAILED or CANCELLED.

update_time.description: The time of video status updates.

video_info.description: Transcoded video info, will be returned if status is SUCCEEDED.

post.description: Use this API to cancel an ongoing video upload task. If the upload has already succeeded, failed, or been cancelled, this operation will fail and return error.

parameters.description: Shopee's unique identifier for a shop. Required param for most APIs.

request_id.description: The identifier for an API request for error tracking.

error.description: Indicate error type if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

message.description: Indicate error details if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

model_id.description: If the item has no variation, this field will be empty

err_msg.description: the reason why the model cannot be added

unqualified_conditions.description: if the model doesn't meet a criteria, will show the detail in this field

purchase_limit.description:
min=0, 0 means no limit


if the item is in enabled status or the item has models in enabled status, you can't set this field

model_id.description: If the item has variation, this param is necessary.

status.description:
you can use this field to set the status of model


0: disable

1: enable

input_promo_price.description:
promotion price without tax


if the model is enabled(status  = 1) now, you can't set this field, you can only disable the model

if the model is disabled(status  = 0) now and you want to set this field, you should also set status to 1

stock.description:
min=1, Campaign Stock, Campaign stock can only be reserved from either Shopee stock or Seller stock


if the model is enabled(status  = 1) now, you can't set this field, you can only disable the model

if the model is disabled(status  = 0) now and you want to set this field, you should also set status to 1

models.description: If the item has variation, this param is necessary, otherwise please don't use this field

item_status.description:
The status of the item. If the item has no variation, this param is necessary, otherwise don't use this field


you can use this field to set the status of item


0: disable

1: enable

item_input_promo_price.description:
The promotion price of the item. If the item has no variation, you can use this field to update the promotion price of the item, otherwise don't use this field


if the item is enabled(item_status  = 1) now, you can't set this field, you can only disable the item

if the item is disabled(item_status  = 0) now and you want to set this field, you should also set item_status to 1

item_stock.description:
min=1, The campaign stock of the item. If the item has no variation, you can use this field to update the campaign stock of the item, otherwise don't use this field


if the item is enabled(item_status  = 1) now, you can't set this field, you can only disable the item

if the item is disabled(item_status  = 0) now and you want to set this field, you should also set item_status to 1

status.description:
the status of model in shop flash sale

0: disable

1: enable

2: delete

4: system_rejected, the model is rejected by system

5: manual_rejected, the model is rejected manually

reject_reason.description: if the status is 4 or 5, this field will show the reason why this model was rejected

unqualified_conditions.description: if the model doesn't meet a criteria, will show the detail in this field

models.description: If the item has variation, the infomation of model will be in this field

status.description:
item status


0: Deleted
1: Normal

2: reviewing

3: banned

4: invalid

5: invalid hide

6: offensive hide

7: auditing

8: normal unlist

item_status.description:
the status of item in shop flash sale. If the item has variation, this field will be empty

0: disable

1: enable

2: delete

4: system_rejected, the item is rejected by system

5: manual_rejected, the item is rejected manually

original_price.description: original price of item, if the item has variation, this field will be empty

input_promotion_price.description: promotion price without tax of item, if the item has variation, this field will be empty

promotion_price_with_tax.description: promotion price with tax of item, if the item has no variation, this field will has value

purchase_limit.description:
0 means NO LIMIT


purchase limit of item, if the item has variation, this field will be empty

campaign_stock.description: campaign stock of item, if the item has no variation, this field will has value

stock.description: Active inventory of item, if the item has no variation, this field will has value

reject_reason.description:
if the item_status is 4 or 5, this field will show the reason why this item was rejected


if the item has variation, this field will be empty

unqualified_conditions.description:
if the item doesn't meet a criteria, will show the detail in this field


if the item has variation, this field will be empty
